intro: Phagnalon borianum, commonly known as the alpine phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, often on rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are characteristic of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Phagnalon borianum plays a role in stabilizing soil in mountainous areas and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
